zone.line: mingles the fragrance of all the flowers
of the field and adds an harmonizing
& quickening and harmonizing spirit
of its own which endows the sense
it's
with a power of sustaining the extreme
delight. which it communicates. The
bucolic, deli & erotic delicacy in
written poetry is correlative with
that softness in statuary music & the
kindred arts, & even in manners &
institutions which distinguished the
epoch to which we now refer. Nor
is it to the poetical faculty itself;
or any mis application of it to which
this want of harmony is to be imputed.
An equal sensibility to the influence
-ence of the senses & the affections is to
be found in the writings of Homer &
Sophocles: the former especially has
clothed sensual & pathetic images
with irresistible attractions. Their
superiority over these succeeding
